Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • encryptChat.SendReceiveFile
      • encryptChat.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Client
extends SendReceiveFile
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Create a SSl socket and attempts to connect to the server
    Author:
    Francesco Cozzolino

      java.lang.String name,
      java.lang.String password,
      ViewObserver controller,
      ModelInterface model,
      java.lang.String keyStore)
       throws java.io.IOException
        loads your own keystore and server's keystore you want to connect.Starts a new thread that tries to connect to the server
        Parameters:
        ip - ip address of server
        port - router's port of server
        name - user's name of server side
        password - password of your keystore
        controller -
        model -
        keyStore - name of your keystore
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the keystore doesn't exist or the password is wrong
        See Also:
        ViewObserver, ModelInterface

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread tries to connect and listens input stream of server and show messages or downlaod file that come from him.if is inactive for a minute or more in both sending and receiving, the client will disconnect from the server automatically
